creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: images of landscapes alternating with calligraphy; teal silk covered accordion album; dark blue fabric covered portfolio
inscription:
Facing pages 1: 読書餘事 {Dokusho yoji} (Reading and other things).
Facing pages 2: 古道照幽処　真人了夙緑　澗辺多白石　竹裏見清泉　散髪且長嘯　逍遙独楽天　有時明月到　影落酒杯前 {?} (In this place, where the ancient Way shines forth in mystery, / the True Man brings past karma to an end. / Beside the gully, many whitened rocks; / among bamboo appears the crystal stream. / I let down my hair and whistle out long each day, / wander free and easy, enjoying nature alone. / From time to time the bright moon comes, / its reflection appearing right in my cup of wine.)
Facing pages 3: [Bamboo forest]
Facing pages 4: 白首楽今日　幽居賦古情　山中自存道　林下便託生　経雨梅初発　得煙柳已成　出門春靄々　草色向人平 {?} (In vain they say, \"Take joy in these days!\" / -- Living in seclusion, I write poems on ancient feelings. / Here in the mountains I naturally preserve the Way; / beneath forest trees I now have lodged my life. / The rain has passed, the plums put forth first blossoms; / with mist to clothe them, willow-buds already formed. / I go out the gate -- Spring is vague and misty; / painting its colors, facing men in peace.)
Facing pages 5: [Plum tree garden]
Facing pages 6: 独為高臥士　始識布衣尊　君若信吾道　暫来同静言　麈寰非不楽　無処植芳根　采々贈蘭蕙　幽香希尚存 {?} (Alone, I\'ve become a scholar of noble reclusion, / starting to sense how venerable is this life in plain clothes. / Should you suddenly come to believe in my Way, / please come visite, and we\'ll share our tranquil words. / It\'s not that the dusty realm is utterly without pleasures, / but it lacks any ground to plant the Fragrant Root. / Year after year I send out these \"elegant orchids\'\" / hoping the subtle perfume may be preserved.)
Facing pages 7: [Clouds amidst mountains]
Facing pages 8: 我来先撫掌　客至亦怡顔　此地頗幽邃　白雲隔世寰　遂為林下士　悠然独見山　問余笑不答　天地与心閑 {?} (Years ago I was first to clap my hands. / When guests arrived, it brought joy to my face! / But this place is quite remote, secluded, / only the white clouds return to the worldly sphere. / And so I became a \"scholar beneath the woods,\" / trance-like, alone viewing mountains... / All I do is smile and never answer: / heaven and earth, together with

title: The Album of Untrammeled Living
